results.title: Love of books
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”.
Brief glimpses into the work of British printers and bookmakers. The film shows the reading room of the British Museum; Oliver, the calligraphist and illuminator; Caxton’s first Chaucer; the binding and print in some 18th century volumes; publishers; children’s books and much more.

results.title: Health
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”.
Cinemagazine newsreel items including: 1. Research on the common cold at Havard Hospital, Salisbury, using human beings for test purposes. 2. The manufacture of hypodermic needles and syringes. 3. Limbless people learning to use aritifical legs and arms at a National Health Service Clinic.

results.title: Auto suggestion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”.
Illustrates technical advances in the British motor-car industry showing the fine quality and workmanship of products manufactured. Cars shown include the following: Daimler Straight Eight, Rolls-Royce Silver Wraith, Morris Minor, Vauxhall Wyvern, Austin A40, Hillman Minx, Ford Prefect, Triumph Mayflower, Jaguar XK120 amd Mark VII Saloon, Ford Consul, Triumph Roadster, production version of the 2.1/2 litre Aston Marton, Bristol 401, and the experimental Rover Gas Turbine prototype.

results.title: This Is America
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Golden Gate
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is America”.
San Francisco is the subject of this United States Travel Service program, from the series, “This Is America”. It is a colourful and breezy look at the Californian city which attracts so many tourists annually. Highlights include Fisherman’s Wharf, the Golden Gate Bridge, Chinatown and Alcatraz

results.title: Hal Porter
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia Council archival film series: writers I”.
A witty, biting commentary about life and an author’s place in it. Hal Porter reminisces about teaching, acting, producing for the theatre, and his life in Melbourne, Bairnsdale and Japan.

group.title: Australia Council archival film series: writers I

results.title: Christina Stead
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia Council archival film series: writers I”.
In the only filmed interview with one of Australia’s most popular and respected novelists, Christina Stead is both challenging and revealing.

group.title: Australia Council archival film series: writers I

results.title: Marjorie Barnard
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia Council archival film series: writers I”.
Historical novelist, Marjorie Barnard recalls priceless memories of fellow writers who “peopled her world”, including Xavier Herbert, Vance and Nettie Palmer and Frank Dalby Davison.

group.title: Australia Council archival film series: writers I

results.title: Gwen Harwood
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia Council archival film series: writers I”.
A charming film of poet Gwen Harwood speaking at her home in Tasmania about her work in poetry and her love for music and opera.
